converted_full.description: Full conversion to Chin-Yew's format with rationale

dimension_templates.S1: The response should state the meeting [SUBJECT], [DATE/TIME], [TIMEZONE], and [ATTENDEES] accurately
dimension_templates.S2: The response should include a backward timeline from T‚ÇÄ with dependency-aware sequencing
dimension_templates.S3: The response should assign an owner for each [TASK] or specify role/skill placeholder if name unavailable
dimension_templates.S4: The response should list [DELIVERABLES] with working links, version/format specified
dimension_templates.S5: The response should include due dates for every [TASK] aligned with timeline sequencing
dimension_templates.S6: The response should identify [DEPENDENCIES/BLOCKERS] with mitigation steps documented
dimension_templates.S11: The response should include concrete [RISK MITIGATION] strategies with owners
dimension_templates.S18: The response should list [POST-EVENT ACTIONS] (wrap-up, retrospectives, reporting)
dimension_templates.S19: The response should disclose [CAVEATS], [ASSUMPTIONS], and [CLARIFICATIONS] about information gaps or uncertainties
dimension_templates.G1: All people mentioned must exist in {source.ATTENDEES}
dimension_templates.G3: All files must exist in {source.ENTITIES where type=File}
dimension_templates.G5: No entities introduced that don't exist in source

sample_conversions.utterance: Help me make a workback plan for the upcoming meeting 'Canary Pipeline Debrief & Metrics Analysis'
sample_conversions.response:
Here‚Äôs your **comprehensive workback plan** for the meeting:

---

# ‚úÖ Workback Plan for **‚ÄúCanary Pipeline Debrief & Metrics Analysis‚Äù**
**Meeting Date:** Friday, **2025-07-25**, **08:00‚Äì08:30 UTC**  
**Organizer:** Keren Guisbert  
**Attendees:** Cortez Dehn (DevOps), Rufina Ganie (Software Eng), Myles Mckoan (QA), Keren Guisbert  
**Location:** Online ‚Äì [Teams Meeting Link](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/120c38b1-775f-4a54-98b5-e01822bbda69)  
**Objective:** Review canary pipeline run results, analyze deployment success/error counts/performance metrics, and plan next steps before production promotion.  
**Current Time:** 2025-07-18 16:00 (+08:00).  
‚è≥ **Time Remaining:** ~7 days (1 workweek) ‚Üí tight but feasible.

---

## üìÖ Timeline Overview
The plan works backward from **July 25** to today, balancing time for metrics collection, Q&A alignment, pre-read prep, and final setup.

---

## **Phase 1: Final Prep (Day Before Meeting)**  
| Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|------|----------|-------|-------|
| Finalize **meeting deck** with charts, success/error rates, latency graphs | **Thu, 2025-07-24, 17:00 UTC** | Keren Guisbert | Incorporate all QA validation and DevOps performance snapshots; confirm baseline vs canary deltas |
| Send **pre-read email** + link to dashboard snapshot + Teams link | **Thu, 2025-07-24, EOD** | Keren | Mention questions to prep (promotion criteria, rollback gates) |
| Confirm **Teams meeting logistics** (recording enabled, screen share) | **Thu, 2025-07-24** | Keren | Buffer for last-minute tech checks |

---

## **Phase 2: Analysis & Material Prep (Mid-Week)**  
| Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|------|----------|-------|-------|
| QA validates **error counts & performance metrics** in staging | **Wed, 2025-07-23** | Myles Mckoan | Confirm thresholds in Jenkins canary job logs |
| DevOps aggregates **deployment success stats**, rollback triggers, pipeline logs | **Wed, 2025-07-23** | Cortez Dehn | Pull final Prometheus summaries & Azure DevOps pipeline history |
| Prepare **summary dashboard exports** (Grafana / Pipeline JSON) | **Wed, 2025-07-23** | Keren | Use latest snapshots; include runbook drilldown links for on-call |
| Draft meeting **agenda slide** (what we review, open decisions) | **Wed, 2025-07-23** | Keren | Keep concise: metrics summary, decision gates, next deployment window |

---

## **Phase 3: Team Checkpoint (Early Next Week)**  
| Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|------|----------|-------|-------|
| Internal **sync call (15 mins)** to resolve metrics interpretation | **Mon, 2025-07-21** | Keren (with Cortez, Rufina, Myles) | Confirm readiness and clarify any edge-case logs |
| Collate **QA validation notes** on functional regressions (if any) | **Mon, 2025-07-21** | Myles | Provide Jira ticket list; highlight blockers to production push |
| Define **decision criteria doc** for ‚ÄúGo/No-Go‚Äù after meeting | **Mon, 2025-07-21** | Cortez | Keep in shared drive for quick reference during meeting |

---

## **Phase 4: Immediate Next Steps (Today + Weekend)**  
| Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|------|----------|-------|-------|
| Retrieve **canary run artifacts**: Jenkins logs, metrics snapshots | **Fri, 2025-07-18 (today)** | Cortez Dehn | Store under `/pipeline/canary-2025-07` shared path |
| Rufina reviews **code deltas** merged into canary build | **Sat, 2025-07-19** | Rufina | Check for risky commits that could explain spikes |
| Open **draft deck shell** (title, agenda placeholders) | **Sat, 2025-07-19** | Keren | Outline now for faster population later |

---

### üìå Key Assumptions & Risks  
- **Assumption:** Canary metrics finalized by mid-week; no new pipeline failures after July 21.  
- **Risk:** Metrics collection delayed ‚Üí compresses deck prep; mitigate by drafting template early (as planned).  
- **Mitigation:** Early checkpoint on 2025-07-21 ensures issues surface with 3+ days buffer.  

---

## ‚úÖ Quick Links  
- [Teams Meeting Link](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/120c38b1-775f-4a54-98b5-e01822bbda69)  
- Related Docs: *TBD (Keren to confirm if analysis doc or dashboard snapshot is shared before pre-read)*  

---

**Summary:**  
You have a 7-day runway ‚Äì focus this weekend on setting up scaffolding (deck shell, artifact collection), block Monday for alignment, dedicate Wed for heavy analysis + visuals, and leave Thursday for final touches and comms.

---

üëâ Do you want me to **also generate a one-line executive summary** you can paste into the pre-read email, summarizing the meeting objective and required prep? Or **create the actual pre-read template now**?

original_assertions.text: The response should explicitly state the meeting date and time as 2025-07-25 08:00 UTC, matching the scheduled meeting.
The response should schedule a task to send the pre-read email, including the Teams link and dashboard snapshot, at least 24 hours before 2025-07-25 08:00 UTC.
The response should assign ownership for QA validation of error counts and performance metrics to Myles Mckoan with a concrete due date before the meeting.
The response should include a dependency that retrieval of canary run artifacts by Cortez must occur before analysis tasks scheduled mid-week.
The response should reserve time for a team checkpoint alignment call on or before 2025-07-21 to resolve interpretation of canary metrics.
The response should acknowledge that related documentation or dashboard snapshots to be included in the pre-read are marked as TBD and require confirmation.
The response should allocate the final meeting deck preparation task for July 24, clearly identified as to occur after QA and DevOps analysis tasks.
The response should specify that the meeting objective covers reviewing canary pipeline results, error rates, and planning next steps before production promotion.
The response should add a contingency buffer by completing core analysis on July 23, leaving at least one full day for final review.
The response should not contradict the attendee list confirmed in the meeting invite (Keren Guisbert, Cortez Dehn, Rufina Ganie, and Myles Mckoan).

sample_conversions.utterance: Help me make a workback plan for the upcoming meeting 'Canary Pipeline Debrief & Metrics Analysis'
sample_conversions.response:
Here‚Äôs an actionable **workback plan** for your upcoming meeting **"Canary Pipeline Debrief & Metrics Analysis"**, based strictly on the provided enterprise data.

---

## ‚úÖ Meeting Details (from grounding data)
- **Subject:** Canary Pipeline Debrief & Metrics Analysis  
- **Date & Time:** **Friday, July 25, 2025 ‚Äì 08:00‚Äì08:30 UTC**  
- **Organizer:** Keren Guisbert (lod_kerenguisbert)  
- **Attendees:** Cortez Dehn *(you)*, Keren G., Rufina G., Myles M.  
- **Objective (from event body):**  
  > Review outcome of the canary pipeline run, analyze deployment success rates, error counts, performance metrics, and plan next steps before promotion to production.  
- **Location:** Teams Meeting Link  
- **Current time:** 2025-07-18T16:00:00 +08:00 (‚âà7 days before meeting)  
- **Related artifacts:**  
  - *FeatureFlagInfra_Outcomes_Presentation.pdf* (pipeline bake, canary test outcomes)  
  - *FeatureFlagInfra_PipelineMetrics.xlsx* (stage-level timings and success data)  

---

## üîç Context Observations   
- Tight timeline: **7 calendar days**, 5 working days if assuming no weekend work.  
- Related files show metrics and outcomes from previous pipeline work‚Äîshould serve as pre-reads.  
- Attendees are engineering and QA roles ‚Üí expect technical discussion on metrics and quality gates.  
- Objective implies **data consolidation**, **agenda alignment**, and **pre-read distribution** are critical.  

---

## üìÖ Workback Plan (Anchored to July 25, 08:00 UTC)  

### **Phase 1 ‚Äì Final Prep (Meeting Week)**
| #  | Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|----|------|----------|-------|-------|
| 1 | **Validate call logistics** (Teams link, time zones) | **July 23 (Wed)** | Keren (Organizer) | Ensure no conflicts and attendees have link. |
| 2 | **Dry-run review of metrics deck** | **July 24 (Thu), 12:00 UTC** | Cortez | Use *FeatureFlagInfra_Outcomes_Presentation.pdf* and pipeline metrics sheet; confirm all charts are up-to-date. |
| 3 | **Send final reminder with agenda & pre-read links** | **July 24 (Thu), EOD** | Keren | Attach deck link + spreadsheet from shared location. |

---

### **Phase 2 ‚Äì Core Content Finalization**
| #  | Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|----|------|----------|-------|-------|
| 4 | **Draft agenda (include discussion time for next steps)** | **July 21 (Mon)** | Keren + Cortez | Topics: success rate summary, error log analysis, gating thresholds. |
| 5 | **Ingest latest canary run results** | **July 22 (Tue), noon UTC** | Cortez | Pull metrics from pipeline dashboards; update Excel file. |
| 6 | **Update & freeze metrics deck** (*FeatureFlagInfra_Outcomes_Presentation.pdf*) | **July 22 (Tue), EOD** | Cortez | Ensure charts reflect final data; incorporate any delta from last runs. |

---

### **Phase 3 ‚Äì Early Prep & Inputs Collection**
| #  | Task | Due Date | Owner | Notes |
|----|------|----------|-------|-------|
| 7 | **Confirm attendee availability & roles (QA vs Eng)** | **July 19 (Sat)** | Keren | If conflicts arise, escalate for backup rep for QA or DevOps. |
| 8 | **Identify open issues / high-risk anomalies in Canary** | **July 20 (Sun)** | Rufina & Myles | Flag any threshold breaches, error counts so pre-discussion data is visible. |
| 9 | **Collect feedback from stakeholders on focus metrics** | **July 20 (Sun)** | Keren | Ping team on Slack/Teams channels for any extra agenda items. |

---

## üóí Notes / Assumptions
- **Time zone check:** Meeting is in UTC; confirm local times for attendees.  
- **Artifacts already exist** (PDF + XLSX) ‚Üí no need to generate new templates.  
- Owners inferred from roles:  
  - *Cortez (you)* = DevOps metrics + deck update  
  - *Keren* = Organizer + agenda/logistics  
  - *Rufina & Myles* = QA/engineering anomaly validation  
- Using buffer: key content frozen by **EOD July 22**, allows 2 days for distribution and last-minute fixes.  
- Weekends included for availability check only; real work targeted on weekdays.  

---

### ‚úÖ Summary Timeline
- **T-6 days:** Confirm attendees & collect metric focus inputs (July 19‚Äì20)  
- **T-4 days:** Agenda finalized; metrics refreshed (July 21‚Äì22)  
- **T-1 day:** Pre-read & reminder sent; deck dry run (July 24)  
- **Day 0:** Meeting at 08:00 UTC on July 25  

---

Do you want me to **auto-generate a consolidated pre-read packet link** (combining *PipelineMetrics.xlsx* and *Outcomes_Presentation.pdf*) and add **a timeline view (Gantt-like) for clarity**?

original_assertions.text: The response should explicitly state the meeting date and time as July 25, 2025, 08:00 UTC, matching the scheduled event.
The response should assign distinct owners to all listed tasks, namely Keren, Cortez, Rufina, and Myles, with no task left unassigned.
The response should include a task to update and freeze the metrics deck before distributing pre-reads, and state that this update completes before the reminder email is sent.
The response should provide due dates for all preparation tasks that precede the meeting and show those dates occur before July 25, 2025.

The response should reference the specific pre-read artifacts FeatureFlagInfra_Outcomes_Presentation.pdf and FeatureFlagInfra_PipelineMetrics.xlsx and schedule their distribution at least one day before the meeting.
The response should include a note stating that task owners were inferred from attendee roles, indicating an explicit assumption was made.
